conclusion: Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for particles A and B during their acceleration phases.
For particle A, the acceleration phase is from t = 0 to t = t_0.
For particle B, the acceleration phase is from t = 0 to t = 5t_0.
For particle A, the velocity at t = t_0 is 2v_0.
For particle B, the velocity at t = 5t_0 is v_0.
The acceleration of particle A is a_A = (2v_0 - 0)/t_0 = 2v_0/t_0.
The acceleration of particle B is a_B = (v_0 - 0)/(5t_0) = v_0/(5t_0).
The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B is Ratio = (2v_0/t_0) / (v_0/(5t_0)) = 2 * 5 = 10.
The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B during their acceleration phases is 10.
